author: Hadriana Lowenkron
description: President Donald Trump moved to dramatically downsize the National Security Council, part of a restructuring that could see the group responsible for coordinating and implementing foreign policy at the White House cut in half.
title: Trump Downsizes National Security Council in Latest Staff Cuts

author: Maciej Martewicz, Natalia Ojewska
description: Poland’s governing-party presidential candidate came out fighting in an election debate, laying into his opponent’s apparent lack of experience and blaming him for failures of the previous nationalist administration.
title: Polish Ruling-Party Candidate Fights Back in Presidential Debate

author: Sridhar Natarajan
description: Paul Weiss, one of the law firms that reached a settlement with Donald Trump’s administration over past work with his perceived opponents, just lost a group of senior litigators.
title: Paul Weiss Loses Senior Litigators in Wake of Trump Deal

author: Alessandra Migliaccio, Craig Stirling
description: Italy’s credit score is skewed toward a potential upgrade at Moody’s Ratings, which has just joined rivals in rewarding Premier Giorgia Meloni’s push for fiscal restraint.
title: Meloni Wins Hope of Moody’s Italy Upgrade From Brink of Junk

author: Gregory Korte
description: Daily revenue from US customs duties rose to a record $16.5 billion as American importers made monthly payments to the government for goods received in April.
title: US Importers Pay Record $16.5 Billion as April Tariff Bill Lands

author: Joe Deaux
description: President Donald Trump backed a partnership between United States Steel Corp. and Japan’s Nippon Steel Corp., crediting his tariff policies for an investment that would keep the iconic American firm in the US.
title: Trump Backs US Steel, Nippon Partnership After National Security Review

author: Zoe Tillman, Greg Stohr
description: The US Supreme Court temporarily blocked a lower-court order that would force Elon Musk’s Department of Government Efficiency to turn over documents to a watchdog group and make a top official available to testify.
title: Supreme Court Pauses Order for DOGE Records and Testimony

author: Antonia Mufarech, Matthew Malinowski
description: Chile’s government is readying legislation to unlock billions of dollars of investments by speeding up the approval process, following years of complaints over excessive red tape, Finance Minister Mario Marcel said.
title: Chile Finance Chief Wants to Unlock Billions in New Investments

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy, Hadriana Lowenkron, Mark Gurman
description: President Donald Trump said that the tariffs he threatened against Apple Inc. earlier Friday would also be aimed at a wider range of device makers including Samsung Electronics Co. to spur them into moving manufacturing of their products to the US.
title: Trump Targets Samsung and Apple Phones With 25% Tariff Threat

author: Alberto Nardelli
description: US President Donald Trump blasted the European Union’s latest trade proposal, rejecting offers to jointly remove tariffs on industrial goods, to boost access for some American agricultural products and to co-develop AI data centers, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Here’s What’s in the EU Trade Proposal That Trump Just Rejected

author: Marion Halftermeyer, Daniel Flatley
description: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said the Trump administration paused plans to create a sovereign wealth fund as the president prioritizes paying down the national debt.
title: Bessent Says Trump Paused Sovereign Wealth Fund to Focus on Debt

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: President Donald Trump on Friday signed orders meant to accelerate the construction of nuclear power plants, including small, untested designs that offer the promise of rapid deployment but have yet to be built in the US.
title: Trump Signs Orders to Revive US Leadership in Nuclear Power

author: Elizabeth Rembert, Janet Lorin
description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said President Donald Trump is “moving forward” with efforts to revoke Harvard University’s tax-exempt status, ratcheting up the government’s high-profile clash with one of the nation’s wealthiest and most prestigious schools.
title: Bessent Says Trump Administration Moving Forward on Harvard Tax Threat

author: Andreina Itriago
description: Venezuela detained former lawmaker Juan Pablo Guanipa on Friday, a close aide of opposition leader María Corina Machado, just days before regional and parliamentary elections Sunday.
title: Venezuela Detains an Opposition Leader on Poll-Boycott Claims

author: Brendan Murray
description: European officials sought to portray a unified calm after US President Donald Trump threatened to impose a 50% tariff on the bloc’s imports, a potential escalation that sent stocks tumbling on both sides of the Atlantic on concerns a trade war will disrupt the world’s largest commercial and investment relationship.
title: European Officials Urge ‘Calm’ Facing Trump 50% Tariff Threat

author: Arne Delfs
description: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz called on President Xi Jinping to support a joint US-European push to achieve a ceasefire in Ukraine, in his first phone call with the Chinese leader on Friday.
title: Merz Calls on Xi to Support Ukraine Peace Effort in First Call

author: Brian Platt
description: Canada’s new energy minister said it’s critical to build carbon-capture systems for the oil sands and identified crude and natural gas exports as a major priority for Prime Minister Mark Carney’s government.
title: Carney’s Energy Chief Pushes Oil Sands to Build Carbon-Capture Systems

author: Chiara Albanese, Alessandra Migliaccio
description: Italy is set to keep the strict conditions it imposed on UniCredit SpA to take over rival lender Banco BPM SpA, even if the bidder starts a legal battle to ease those terms.
title: Italy Plans to Stick With Its Tough Terms on UniCredit’s BPM Bid

author: Kateryna Chursina, Aliaksandr Kudrytski
description: Ukraine said its drones hit production facilities of a company that makes batteries used to power Russian missiles.
title: Ukraine Says Drones Struck Russian Battery Plant for Missiles

author: Janet Lorin
description: Harvard University said it is filing a lawsuit over the Trump administration’s move to block it from enrolling international students.
title: Harvard Says It Sues US Over Trump Foreign Student Ban

author: Patrick Sykes
description: Iran and the US have started their next round of talks on the Islamic Republic’s nuclear program, the semi-official Iranian Students’ News Agency reported.
title: Iran and US Start Fifth Round of Nuclear Talks in Rome

author: Piotr Bujnicki
description: Poland intercepted and deterred a Russian bomber aircraft over the Baltic Sea late on Thursday, according to Defense Minister Wladyslaw Kosiniak-Kamysz.
title: Poland Says Intercepted Russian Su-24 Bomber Over Baltic Sea

author: Skylar Woodhouse
description: President Donald Trump threatened a 50% tariff on goods from the European Union starting on June 1, saying “our discussions with them are going nowhere.”
title: Trump Threatens a 50% Tariff on EU Goods Starting in June

author: Jorge Valero, Volodymyr Verbianyi
description: The European Union has agreed to reinstate quotas on imports of several agricultural goods from Ukraine, adding to the challenges faced by its war-hit economy.
title: EU Agrees to Reinstate Trade Quotas on Ukraine as War Drags on

author: Skylar Woodhouse
description: President Donald Trump threatened Apple Inc. with a tariff of at least 25% if the tech company does not manufacture iPhones in the US.
title: Trump Threatens 25% Tariffs on Apple If iPhones Not US Made

author: Aliaksandr Kudrytski, Moira Warburton
description: US President Donald Trump said Russia and Ukraine had carried out a “major” prisoner swap, lauding the yet-to-be-confirmed move as a sign of progress as his efforts to broker an agreement to end the war have faltered.
title: Trump Lauds ‘Major’ Prisoner Swap Between Ukraine and Russia

author: Michael Cohen
description: South Africa’s police minister rejected the false conspiracy theory spread by US President Donald Trump that White farmers are being subjected to a genocide, saying it is “totally unsubstantiated.”
title: South African Police Minister Debunks Trump’s Genocide Claim

author: Bei Hu, Colum Murphy
description: The Trump administration’s sudden move to bar foreign students at Harvard University is seen as dealing a blow to the US’s standing in business — and handing an advantage to elite rival colleges across the English-speaking world.
title: Trump Attack on Harvard Students Reverberates Across World

author: Erik Wasson, Chris Cioffi, Alex Harris
description: Chances of a close brush with a US payment default are growing as the Senate plans for time-consuming revisions to President Donald Trump’s sprawling, multi-trillion-dollar tax and spending package.
title: US Debt Limit Nail-Biter Looms as Senate Ponders Trump Tax Bill

author: Katia Dmitrieva
description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Trump’s War on Harvard Is Good News for China

author: Jorge Valero, Viktoria Dendrinou, Slav Okov
description: Bulgaria is close to clearing a major hurdle toward euro adoption, putting the Black Sea nation on course to join the currency area next year.
title: Bulgaria Is on Track to Win EU Approval to Join the Euro Next Year

author: Liezel Hill
description: Alexey Mordashov, one of Russia’s richest men, has found an unexpected adversary in the governor of the region where his steelmaker, Severstal PJSC, operates, the latest illustration of the waning power of the country’s tycoons that’s been accelerated by the invasion of Ukraine.
title: Tycoon Mordashov’s Local Spat Signals Changing Elite in Russia

author: Selcan Hacaoglu
description: Turkey banned the use of images depicting jailed Istanbul Mayor Ekrem Imamoglu and detained dozens of municipality staff, escalating a standoff with the opposition that’s unsettled investors.
title: Turkey Bans Images of Jailed Istanbul Mayor in Growing Crackdown

author: Denis Chabrol, Fabiola Zerpa
description: Suriname is heading to the polls in an election that will help shape how the South American country adapts to its newfound oil wealth.
title: Suriname Elects New President to Navigate Its Impending Oil Boom

author: Jenny Leonard, Brendan Murray
description: Halfway through President Donald Trump’s 90-day freeze on his so-called reciprocal tariffs, a persistent gripe from businesses, consumers and governments facing them is severe uncertainty. The next 45 days may not provide much relief from the fog.
title: US Tariff Countdown Has Nations Racing to Turn Talks Into Deals

author: Konrad Krasuski
description: The slump in Polish stocks, one of the year’s global equity standouts, signals that traders are increasingly jittery about any more political surprises.
title: Poland’s Surging Stocks Tested by Neck-and-Neck Runoff Election

author: Jamie Nimmo
description: RedBird Capital Partners agreed to buy the Telegraph in a £500 million ($674 million) deal, ending two years of uncertainty for the UK newspaper group.
title: RedBird Agrees to Buy Telegraph, Ending UK Newspaper’s Limbo

author: Tracy Alloway, Joe Weisenthal
description: Rent freezes, city-run grocery stores, and more Halal carts.
title: Zohran Mamdani, the Socialist Who Could Be NYC's New Mayor

author: Patrick Sykes
description: Iran said it’s “time to decide” ahead of Friday’s nuclear talks with the US, with the main sticking point being whether Tehran will be able to continue enriching uranium.
title: Iran Says ‘Time to Decide’ Ahead of New Nuclear Talks With US

author: Alberto Nardelli
description: The European Union’s trade chief, Maros Sefcovic, is planning to hold a call with Jamieson Greer, his US counterpart, on Friday to take stock of talks, according to a European Commission spokesperson.
title: EU and US to Hold Trade Call Friday Amid Differences on Tariffs

author: Andreo Calonzo, Ditas B Lopez
description: Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. retained Ralph Recto as his finance chief and the rest of his economic team amid a Cabinet revamp, signaling continuity in his economic agenda.
title: Philippines’ Marcos Keeps Economic Team Amid Cabinet Shakeup

author: Foster Wong
description: The Trump administration’s move to block Harvard University from enrolling international students doesn’t just put more financial pressure on the school but also threatens a cradle for global political leaders.
title: These World Leaders Went to Harvard Before Trump’s Foreign Student Ban

author: Josh Xiao, Dan Strumpf
description: The most recent conflict in the longstanding tensions between India and Pakistan may not have directly involved its neighbor, China. Nonetheless, Beijing’s influence looms large.
title: How China Factors Into the Conflict Between India and Pakistan

author: Justice Malala
description: Wednesday’s explosive Oval Office meeting underlines that, for African leaders and beyond, the current US administration is all about the deal.
title: South African President's White House Clash May Have Worked

author: Anthony Capaccio
description: For fans of Tom Cruise’s Mission: Impossible series, the Pentagon can answer the incredulous question at the climax of its latest trailer: “You gave him an aircraft carrier?”
title: Tom Cruise Really Did Get a US Aircraft Carrier for This Mission

author: Yoshiaki Nohara, Akemi Terukina
description: US President Donald Trump initiated a phone call with Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba and discussed tariffs in general terms, just as Tokyo’s top negotiator left for the US for another round of trade talks.
title: Trump Initiated Call With Japan’s Ishiba, Discussed Tariffs

author: Ruchi Bhatia
description: India’s Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal said that he had a “constructive meeting” with his counterpart Howard Lutnick for a mutually beneficial trade agreement between the two countries.
title: India, US Hold ‘Constructive’ Trade Talks, Says Piyush Goyal

author: Shinhye Kang, Hyonhee Shin
description: South Korean presidential candidate Lee Jae-myung saw his lead in the election campaign narrow sharply in the latest opinion poll released Friday as the conservative ruling party’s Kim Moon-soo made up ground after their first TV debate.
title: South Korea’s Presidential Race Tightens Sharply After TV Debate

author: Colum Murphy
description: Former US Treasury Secretary Lawrence Summers blasted the Trump administration’s decision to block Harvard University from enrolling international students, calling on the institution to fight back.
title: Summers Slams Trump’s Move Against Harvard as ‘Stuff of Tyranny’

author: Colum Murphy
description: Beijing and Washington continued high-level contact with a Thursday call between senior officials, a sign that the two sides are maintaining active communications following their trade truce earlier this month.
title: Senior US-China Officials Vow to Keep Communication Lines Open

author: Eric Martin, Jennifer A Dlouhy, Andreina Itriago
description: It took barely 24 hours this week for the Trump administration to execute its latest reversal on Venezuela, with the fate of a huge Chevron Corp. venture hanging in the balance as closed-door White House differences broke into the open.
title: Trump Team’s ‘Game of Thrones’ on Venezuela Whiplashes Chevron

author: Alastair Gale
description: A senior figure involved in the development of an advanced European-Japanese fighter jet justified the amount of resources earmarked for the project over the next decade based on the need to keep pace with China even as the military also faces the near-term risk of more Russian aggression in Europe.
title: Europe-Japan Fighter Jet Races Against China’s Military Progress
